question.title: javafx.controls module can't be found but it exists in the right location [issue solved]
question.body:
I'm using JDK 25, Apache Netbeans and Windows 11. My JavaFX SDK folder is in C:\ and I verified that it is indeed in the lib folder, but the compiler still says it can't find it. I'm pretty sure I initialized the correct VM options. My build tool is Ant.

VM Options:

--module-path "C:\javafx-sdk-25.0.1\lib" --add-modules=javafx.controls,javafx.fxml

build.xml:

Erorr Message I keep getting:

Error occurred during initialization of boot layer
java.lang.module.FindException: Module javafx.fxml not found

Also can't find javafx.controls

What am I possibly doing wrong and why can't the compiler find these two files?

I read some stuff regarding dependencies causing this type of error. If that is the case, how would I be able to configure these dependencies properly?

question_comments.body: I understand from this comment that you have solved your problem. Remember, SO is not just for helping you but for helping all those with a similar problem to yours. If you think that your solution may help others, then post an answer explaining how, exactly you solved the problem. If you don't think your solution will help others, then you should delete your question.
1.8.0_471?  That may be the most recent version of Java 8, but that certainly is not JDK 25, and it will not recognize modules.

@trashgod I followed the Getting Started article and I realised that I was adding the .jar files directly into the Classpath instead of grouping them into a custom Library. For some reason, doing it this way works and fixes my problem. Thank you.
@VGR I don't think so. My java version is 1.8.0_471 which I'm pretty sure is the most recent version possible.
@Abra Added the build.xml file that ant is using.

Verify Getting Started with JavaFX:JavaFX and NetBeans:Non-modular projects:3. Add the library; if you use "Compile on Save," be sure to "add the JavaFX25 library to Properties -> Libraries -> Run -> Modulepath." Using ant is convenient for a scratch project, but maven is supported, too.
Is it possible that you are inadvertently running with a version of Java older than 25, which is unable to recognize the JavaFX modules?
@VGR all necessary .jar files that come in the lib folder when first extracting the zip. contains .controls, .fxml, etc etc. This is why im terribly confused.
Which .jar files are in that directory?
